content: Stephen Voida | College of Communication, Media, Design and Information | University of Colorado Boulder Skip to main content TranslateEnglishSpanishChineseFrenchGermanKoreanLaoNepaliJapaneseTibetanSearchEnter the terms you wish to search for.This siteAll of Colorado.eduOther ways to search:Events CalendarCampus MapCurrent StudentsAlumniVisitFaculty & Staff ResourcesStephen VoidaAssociate ProfessorFounding FacultyAssociate Chair of Graduate StudiesINFORMATION SCIENCE svoida@Colorado.EDU 303-492-9140 WebsiteAddress  INFO 294Office HoursTuesdays and Thursdays 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., and by appointment, email instructor for link.Associate Professor Stephen Voida conducts empirical, design, and systems research in the areas of personal informatics and personal information management, with a focus on developing tools that help people to collect, interpret, and reflect on the data streams they create and the digital artifacts they encounter on an everyday basis. He also uses these data to study phenomena like multitasking, interruptions and mobile knowledge work.Voida’s research has been recognized with best paper awards and supported by Google Research, NSF and a CRA Computing Innovation fellowship. His work has appeared in The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, The Atlantic, Lifehacker.com and on the APM Marketplace Tech Report. Dr. Voida holds a PhD in computer science and a MS in human–computer interaction from the Georgia Institute of Technology. He was previously at Indiana University, Indianapolis and has held positions at Cornell; University of California, Irvine; University of Calgary; IBM T.J.
